message: 1995 I hitched from San Francisco to Petersburg, AK. It was my great adventure, spent a year traveling the west coast met some amazing people AND learned to drive a fork lift on the docks unloading boats. To be young and fearless.

I'm sorry you had to deal with stupid security officers and store owners... ; however, maybe that Asian salon owner wasn't being racist but rather did not have the education to cut coarser hair and was knowledgeable enough to know where her skills lacked ability. I've had terrible haircuts because the stylist didn't have the knowledge to cut my funky asian hair and didn't inform me of that. Unfortunately not all salon schools or hair stylists learn to cut all types of hair. If she was being racist I'm sorry. Personally i wouldn't want to support her business because either she's racist or needs more training.

A 2700 year old papyrus mentioning Jerusalem written in paleo-Hebrew is as much a treasure of Palestinian history as it is of Jewish history, as it is of world history. Propping it up as a exclusively Jewish artifact because it's in Hebrew (as if Palestinian history can't include the Jewish history of Palestine) is as absurd as the denigration of Arabic as a non-Jewish language, when in fact some of the great works of Jewish philosophy and poetry are in Arabic. To draw nationalist, sectarian lines around complex, multifaceted cultural products ignores the deep connections of all peoples in the region.
